intro: Lomatogonium rotatum subsp. tenuifolium, commonly known as the slender-leafed lomatogonium, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, pale yellow to greenish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes caraway and parsley. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
